title: AI Liability: Who Is Responsible When AI Fails?
description: A quick, practical guide to AI Liability: Who Is Responsible When AI Fails?.

hook.text: An AI misdiagnoses a patient. Who's liableâ€”the hospital, the vendor, or the model?

buildup.text: Current law wasn't designed for autonomous AI decisions. Liability gaps exist.

discovery.text: Options: strict liability for vendors, negligence standards for deployers, or shared responsibility.

twist.text: The 'black box' problem: if nobody can explain why the AI decided, proving fault is harder.

climax.text: Document decisions, maintain human oversight, and carry appropriate insurance.

punchline.text: AI decides. Humans are still accountable.

quiz.question: What complicates AI liability?
options: AI decisions are hard to explain (black box problem)
